casebody.data:
PLACID OIL COMPANY, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. The FEDERAL ENERGY ADMINISTRATION and John F. O’Leary, Administrator (now the Department of Energy and James R. Schlesinger, Secretary of Energy), Defendants-Appellees. No. 5-37. Temporary Emergency Court of Appeals. Argued June 22, 1979. Decided July 13, 1979. A. B. Conant, Jr., Shank, Irwin, Conant, Williamson & Grevelle, Dallas, Tex., of counsel, with whom Morgan, Lewis & Bock-ius, Washington, D. C., and Paul W. Hicks, Placid Oil Co., Dallas, Tex., on brief, for plaintiff-appellant. Dina R. Lassow, Dept, of Justice, Washington, D. C., with whom Barbara Allen Babcock, Asst. Atty. Gen., and C. Max Vas-*814sanelli, Washington, D. C., on brief, for defendants-appellees.

Before MORGAN, BECKER and GEW-IN, Judges.

PER CURIAM:

Having heard oral argument and after considering the record and briefs on this appeal, the court finds no reversible error and therefore affirms on the well-reasoned opinion of Judge Higginbotham. See D.C., 465 F.Supp. 1199.
